page.title: 20Churches in Collingham
page.content: There are 4 places of worship in Collingham;the Church of{St.John the {Baptist }in South Collingham dating from the 12th century,the Church of{ {All Saints }in North Collingham dating from the 13th century,the{Baptist } Chapel which was founded in 1662 and the{Methodist }Church on the High St. which was built in 1855. That Collingham is able to support{ {four churches }is commendable by todays standards.But during the week there are guilds,choir practices and fellowships.The churches are linked through{Collingham Christian Council } which is exploring the possibilities of joining together in worship and working together in outreach. The work for this survey was undertaken by the children and teachers of John Blow Primary School and groups of adults from the village.
